description:
Chornobyl is a partially abandoned city in the Chornobyl Exclusion Zone, situated in the Vyshhorod Raion of northern Kyiv Oblast, Ukraine. Chornobyl is about 90 kilometres north of Kyiv, and 160 kilometres southwest of the Belarusian city of Gomel.
The city's name is the same as one of the Ukrainian names for Artemisia vulgaris, mugwort or common wormwood, and is roughly translated as "black stalks".
